column2: WORK DESCRIPTION
PRE-CONSTRUCTION
Engineering - Drawings, Inspections, TWIA Submittals, Required Architectural Plans
Home Inspection - photograph and document pre-existing condition of home
Surveys - Elevation Certificate Pre-lift, Post-lift, and Final Elevation Certificate
SITE PREPARATION
Mobilization, Site Prep (includes breaking up and the removal and disposal of concrete), Equipment, Supervision, Labor
Remove existing landscaping required for elevation, it is the homeowners obligation to maintain landscaping removed, installation of Silt fence
Site toilet, dumpster and hauling off debris
Tree Removal (Regular)
Tree Removal (Large)
Tree Trimming
EXCAVATION, PILES, ELEVATION
Tunneling/Excavating (lnft) to faciltate the installation of 8"x8" concrete pilings

Raise, Shore and Align above mentioned residence to satisfy BFE and local free board requirements; according to engineer specifications. Contractor to provide all block, shims, and angle iron, or any other materials required during lift.
FOUNDATION
Install 8"x8" concrete pillings to support the existing concrete slab under residence to the point of refusal, where engineer has specified to provide sufficient weight load support.
Pour 24"X24" continuous reinforced concrete footer as per engineer specifications

Install 16" X 16" pialister block concrete column with four (4) #5 rebar tied into footings and original slab with epoxy for structural support in accordance with engineer specifications.  (columns will be pumped solid with concrete using pump truck to avoid cold joints)
Labor and material to install  painted steel beams WF 8" x 18#/ft. to span areas for interior columns per engineered specifications

Pour concrete slab under raised home per engineered specifications. Price includes pump truck as required. Install three (3) sided CMU block wall with required flood vents.  This includes the required rebar and concrete fill as required by Engineer Specifications.
UTILITIES
Disconnect and reconnect/repair water, sewer / septic, gas as required by local building agencies
Disconnect, Raise and reconnect A/C system(s) to new elevated height requirements
Disconnect and reconnect electrical as required by local building agencies
STEPS, LANDINGS, CARPENTRY
Construct 4'X4' landing to meet program requirements (including stairs and handrails)A raise height above 12 feet will require a landing as per code; larger and increased number of support posts.
Construct 4'X8' landing to meet program requirements (including stairs and handrails)A raise height above 12 feet will require a landing as per code; larger and increased number of support posts.
It is more cost effective to connect egress points with a 4' walkway than construct multiple stairways
FINISHES AND LANDSCAPING
Equipment, dirt and labor to allow for proper grading as required by local agencies
Pallets of Sod with labor and installation
Detach and reset fence; included in bid price
Extend gutter to ground level; included in bid price
Repair existing sprinkler system after completion of elevation, included in bid price
Post site cleanup
Spray foam insulation  underneath elevated slab (closed cell insulation =Minimum of R-13)
Repair / replace concrete damaged during elevation (sqft.)
Add Wood Handrails to Elevated Porch Area /Deck
Detach breezeway and properly repair roofline and Home
Warranty, Supervison,Overhead
ADA Approved Items
ADA Personal Lift
Eligible Elevation Costs
Bonding & Insurance
Draw #1  Amount
